Package at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf

This package contains the Java interface to the driver layer used in the software-defined gateway G2021.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DataPointObserver
    All classes implementing this interface can be registered at data points.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractDataPointObserverImplementation
    This is an abstract implementation of the DataPointObserver interface.
    BufferManager
    The BufferManager is used to create, configure and delete buffers.
    DataPoint
    This is the basic interface to actor and sensor data, which can be used by GBots.
    TimeControl
    This class offers a time triggered retrieval of all the buffer values.

Package at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf Description

This package contains the Java interface to the driver layer used in the software-defined gateway G2021. It implements the access to sensor / actor data in an uniform way and supports the configuration of the low level interface to the device drivers (so called buffers).

The basic interface to actors and sensor data is implemented in the class DataPoint. An instance of the class DataPoint is simply an interface to all the buffer values needed by an higher level application (so called GBot).

As requested time triggered retrieval of all the buffer values is implemented in the class TimeControl. A simple timer is used, to retrieve the buffer values (method DataPoint.getAll()) and put them into a blocking queue. The timer can be started, stopped and restarted. State changes of buffers or transient value changes have no effect to the content of the output queue or the mode of timer operation. Therefore this kind of data retrieval is not recommended.

The management of the actors and sensors (so called buffers) is an issue of the class BufferManager. For further information look at the BufferManagers class description.
